s.text: While the first two approaches provide reasonable results, they do not guarantee complete success in terms of fold recognition even for the training set proteins.
While the first two approaches provide reasonable results, they do not guarantee complete success in terms of fold recognition even for the training set proteins.
Here, we present one such simplified method to train a potential energy function using a small set of proteins which places a significant number of additional native conformations near its minima.
While the lattice models have usually stayed with single point representation, the continuous state models have used different variations from a single point per residue to all-atom representation.
In this work, we place a milder condition on the training by only asking that the native be near a local minimum.
In this work, we place a milder condition on the training by only asking that the native be near a local minimum.
